title: Jack Layton
summary: John Gilbert Layton PC MSC (July 18, 1950 – August 22, 2011) was a Canadian politician who served as the leader of the New Democratic Party (NDP) from 2003 to 2011 and Leader of the Official Opposition in 2011. He previously sat on Toronto City Council, occasionally holding the title of acting mayor or deputy mayor of Toronto during his tenure as city councillor.[1] Layton was the member of Parliament (MP) for Toronto—Danforth from 2004 until his death.
